intro: Dammara vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis Dammara, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. Dammara vitiensis is adapted to grow in humid, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
